titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John Stansbury account book 1973.100
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:09:24 +0000.

did.abstract: One account book belonging to John Stansbury of the town of Flushing in Queens, N.Y., containing entries recording Stansbury's various transactions throughout the period 1810 to 1821.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One account book belonging to John Stansbury of the town of Flushing in Queens, N.Y., containing entries recording Stansbury's various transactions throughout the period 1810 to 1821. Roughly half the book is also filled with clippings that have been pasted over transaction entries and contain poems and stories from various news publications. Additional members of the Stansbury family, including Cecilia and Isaac Stanbury, are also brielfy represented by entries in the account book: Cecilia used portions of the book to practice long division, while Isaac entered accounts of his own transactions.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: A resident of the town of Flushing in Queens County, N.Y. during the 19th century, John Stansbury owned a farmhouse near Horace Harding and Springfield Boulevards.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The source and date of acquisition for this collection are unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1973.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); John Stansbury account book, 1973.100, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
